items.title: The Best Cities for Minimalists
items.abstract: Few people can toss everything and live off the land, but a new study highlights the cities where principles of simple living are more easily practiced.

items.title: In a Queens Forest, Compiling a Picture of Urban Ecology
items.abstract: With high-tech tools recording data like solar radiation and when buds open, Alley Pond Park could help steer policy-making decisions on climate change and resiliency elsewhere in the country.

items.title: Q. and A. About Birds in New York City
items.abstract: Bird Week: Gabriel Willow, who has been leading wildlife tours for 15 years, answered readersâ€™ questions.

items.title: Remember Pizza Rat? Meet Pollinator Rat.
items.abstract: In a city in Colombia, researchers say, common rodents help a plant produce fruit when they snack on its flower petals.

items.title: How Dangerous Is It to Be a Bird in Your City? Buildings Kill Hundreds of Millions a Year
items.abstract: A new study shows how efforts to prevent migrating birds from flying into skyscrapers and other brightly lit buildings could be honed.
keywords: Frontiers in Ecology and the Environment (Journal)
